svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class is the foundation exception descriptor for the I2C transaction class. The exceptions are errors that may be introduced into transaction, for the purpose of testing how the DUT responds.

Member Function Documentation

  function svt_pattern
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::allocate_pattern
 (   ) 

HDL Support: This method allocates a pattern containing svt_pattern_data instances for all of the primitive data fields in the object. The svt_pattern_data :: name is set to the corresponding field name, the svt_pattern_data :: value is set to 0.

Return values - An svt_pattern instance containing entries for all of the data fields.

  function bit
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::decode_prop_val
 (  string prop_name , bit [1023:0] prop_val , ref string prop_val_string , input svt_pattern_data :: type_enum typ  ) 

Simple utility used to convert 'bit [1023:0]' property value representation into its equivalent string property value representation. Extended to support decoding of enum values.

prop_name - The name of the property being encoded.

prop_val_string - The string describing the value to be encoded.

prop_val - The bit vector encoding of prop_val_string.

typ - Optional field type used to help in the encode effort.

Return values - Status indicating the success/failure of the decode.

 Superseded functions 
 svt_sequence_item_base :: decode_prop_val

  function void
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::set_constraint_weights
 (  int new_weight  ) 

Sets the randomize weights for all *_wt attributes except NO_OP_ERROR_wt to new_weight.

new_weight - Value to set all *_wt attributes to (NO_OP_ERROR_wt is not updated).

Member Attribute Documentation

 rand svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception :: error_kind_enum  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::error_kind = NO_OP_ERROR

Selects the type of error that will be injected.

 int  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR_wt = 1000

Distribution weight controlling the frequency of random HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR error

 protected int  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::NO_OP_ERROR_wt = 1

Weight controlling frequency of NO_OP_ERROR.

This attribute is required to be greater than 0, but will normally be much less than the other _wt values. If this value less than 1 then pre_randomize will set NO_OP_ERROR_wt to 1 and issue a warning message.

 int  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::PEC_ERROR_wt = 1000

Distribution weight controlling the frequency of random PEC_ERROR error

 int  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::SEND_ACK_FOR_START_BYTE_ERROR_wt = 1000

Distribution weight controlling the frequency of random SEND_ACK_FOR_START_BYTE_ERROR error

 int  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR_wt = 1000

Distribution weight controlling the frequency of random SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR error

 svt_i2c_slave_transaction  attribute
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::xact

Handle to the transaction object to which this exception applies. This is made available for use by constraints.

Member Typedef Documentation

 typedef enum  svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::error_kind_enum
A transaction exception identifies the kind of error to be injected
SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR )
Setup time for data violated
HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR )
Hold time for data violated
SEND_ACK_FOR_START_BYTE_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_SEND_ACK_FOR_START_BYTE_ERROR )
Ack sent for Start Byte
NO_OP_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_NO_OP_ERROR )
This error kind selects no error
PEC_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_SLAVE_PEC_ERROR )

Member Constraint Documentation

  constraint
 svt_i2c_slave_transaction_exception::distribution_error_kind

Maintains the error distribution based on the assigned weights.
constraint distribution_error_kind {
    error_kind dist
    {
      SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR := SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR_wt,
      HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR := HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_DATA_ERROR_wt,
      SEND_ACK_FOR_START_BYTE_ERROR := SEND_ACK_FOR_START_BYTE_ERROR_wt,
      NO_OP_ERROR := NO_OP_ERROR_wt,
     PEC_ERROR := PEC_ERROR_wt
    };
  }
